full_text.full_text:
4. Correlation
▪ Measure the linear relationship between two sets of values
– Examples
• x = (1, 2, 3, 4, 5), y = (2, 4, 6, 8, 10) → perfect positive correlation (= 1)
• x = (1, 2, 3, 4, 5), y = (5, 4, 3, 2, 1) → perfect negative correlation (= –1)
▪ There are many types of correlation
– In this course, we focus on Pearson’s correlation
62

text.text: ▪ Measure the linear relationship between two sets of values

• x = (1, 2, 3, 4, 5), y = (2, 4, 6, 8, 10) → perfect positive correlation (= 1)
• x = (1, 2, 3, 4, 5), y = (5, 4, 3, 2, 1) → perfect negative correlation (= –1)
▪ There are many types of correlation
– In this course, we focus on Pearson’s correlation
